userreviews.userReview: Easy to get hooked to, difficult to leave in middle..

UGH, bloody cliff-hanger hit me in the face!This was extremely entertaining for my forensics/mystery cravings. I'm a fantasy girl, but this was done well enough to keep my attention from waving. Reilly and the others all have their own personalities, some a little too extreme to possibly be real (though such people are out there). And it's in Ireland! *thumbs up*The setting of the story made me feel like I had a large insight on Ireland. The plot and suspense was great. The characters and their own lives outside the cases were just as good. I loved it all.I recommend this to those who are intrigued, but I should warn you that the crime scenes are TABOO like the title suggests and rather gruesome in the question of morality and sensibility. Otherwise, it's amazing.

Had never Read any Casey Hill Books... A real Mystery till The End...CSI Reilly Steel... Was brought over from Marin County,CA too Dublin,Ireland To Head the Garda Forensic Unit.With her Flawless Scientific Background,and Graduating from Quantico... She was Ready to Take on This Case...Succeed or Fail !Taboo

I know it's a good book when I look forward to going to bed, so that I can get back to the story. This mystery kept me intrigued throughout the book, and the main character, Reilly, was extremely likable. I figured out the mystery halfway through the book, but it didn't matter, I still needed to know the details. I will read more books in this series.

A bit predictable, but still a fun mystery. It's not nearly as gruesome as Kathy Riechs books, or anywhere as technical, so it would be an easier read in that way. However the language was terrible. There was a ton of swearing, and liberal use of the "f" word. It might be a good idea to wait for the PureMedia filter app before reading this one.

Reilly Steel is a Californian, Quantico trained CSI who has transplanted to Ireland to stay close to her father. A horrific serial killer is loose and Reilly and her team are part of the Garda trying to stop the killer. IS the killer inside the investigation? I want to read more from this author and this series.

The story is well-organized and credible, although it moves slowly at times. CSI Reilly Steel is smart but troubled: The author's abrupt switch to her nightmares was at times distracting, and there were so many extraneous characters that it seemed that there were loose ends. Still this is a promising author, and I expect I will read more.

This is your typical murder mystery, easy brainless read. It wasn't horrible but it wasn't great. To me, it's kind of the water you rinse your mouth with between wine tastings. It was a good "cleansing of the palate" between books. Predictable but still entertaining.

More like 4.5 stars. Decent psychological thriller and a fairly easy read. I enjoyed the mystery but some of the clues were a bit heavy handed, and I figured it out fairly quickly. I really liked the characters and setting—enough to make we want to continue with the rest of the series.

It was a free BookBub title and reasonably well put together. The authors' (husband-wife co-writers) webpage says that it was an international best seller. I wouldn't have thought that, but who am I to judge? It has the earmarks of being a first published book.
Good detective mystery set in Ireland!This story held my interest to the very end. Well written with well defined characters. I recommend this book for anyone interest in mysteries set in Ireland.
Predictable and cliched. Glad I didn't pay for it!
a psychological thriller. e-book. read 2014. See Amazon review.
First book by this author and it was an enjoyable psychological thriller. Look forward to reading more.
Very intriguing book. Good character development of the main characters and it is a page tuner. Kept me guessing who did it. Was completely surprised.
It was just ok for me. Lots of bad language.

description: For fans of Patricia Cornwell, Tess Gerritsen, Karin Slaughter and Kathy Reichs'Very special ... an outstanding forensic debut.' THE BOOKSELLERForensic investigator Reilly Steel, Quantico-trained and California-born and bred, imagined Dublin to be a far cry from bustling San Francisco, a sleepy backwater where she can lay past ghosts to rest and start anew.She's arrived in Ireland to drag the Garda forensics team into the 21st-century plus keep tabs on her Irish-born father who's increasingly seeking solace in the bottle after a past tragedy. But a brutal serial killer soon puts paid to that. A young man and woman are found dead in a hotel room, the gunshot wounds on their naked bodies suggesting a suicide pact. But as Reilly and the team dig deeper, and more bodies are discovered, they soon realise that a twisted murderer is at work, one who seeks to upset society's norms in the most sickening way imaginable…
title: Taboo (CSI Reilly Steel, #1 - Preview)
